etymology.description: 害(害) (hài, "harm") + 怕(怕) (pà, "fear") means to experience fear or be afraid of something bad happening.
etymology.interpretation: The combination of 害(害) (hài, "harm") and 怕(怕) (pà, "fear") suggests the feeling of fear that arises from the anticipation of potential harm or danger.

examples.chinese: 我害怕大雨(我害怕大雨)。
examples.english: I am afraid of heavy rain.

examples.chinese: 当夜深人静时(當夜深人靜時)，我害怕孤独(我害怕孤獨)。
examples.pinyin: Dāng yè shēn rén jìng shí, wǒ hàipà gūdú.
examples.english: When the night is quiet, I am afraid of loneliness.
